citations.narrative:
The facility has a method of documenting acquisitions and dispositions using APHIS Form 7020. However, the record for
the acquisition of two (2) opossums was incomplete and did not identify the name and address of the person from whom
the animal was acquired, date of acquisition, buyer or receiver information, name, and address of the person to whom the
animals were sold or given, or the vehicle license number and State. Accurate record keeping is essential to allow APHIS
to accurately track animals and ensure that all animals are receiving proper care as required by the Animal Welfare Act.
Every licensee shall make, keep, and maintain records which fully disclose information regarding all acquisitions and
dispositions.
Correct by January 12, 2024.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The lemur is the only nonhuman primate in the facility and is unable to see or hear other non-human primates. The facility
environment plan to promote psychological well-being describes enrichment but does not address special considerations.
Certain nonhuman primates must be provided special attention regarding enhancement of their environment, based on
the needs of the individual species, and in accordance with the instructions of the attending veterinarian. The facility must
develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to address the special needs of the lemur.
Correct by January 12, 2024.

The enclosure containing two (2) fennec foxes is constructed of wire fencing. A mat made of bamboo is attached to the
lower part of the fencing and it is used to protect the animals from the elements and provide a visual barrier. The bamboo
mat is broken and has sharp edges, including the wire that was woven through the bamboo that is now broken. The wire
is now hanging from the fence where the bamboo mat is broken. The sharp edges of the bamboo mat and the hanging
wire could cause injury to the foxes.
Indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound must have structural strength and shall be maintained in
good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals. Correct by ensuring enclosures are always
maintained in good repair in order to protect the health and well-being of the animals.
Correct by January 3, 2024.

The facility’s perimeter fence is under 6 ft in height. The land has shifted, and the fence is tilted making it less than 6 ft tall.
There is a large water trough turned upside down next to the perimeter fence in the northeast corner of the site. The water
trough is ~2 ft deep, and has additional material stacked on top of it. In this specific area of the site, the effective fence
height is less than 4 ft tall.
Perimeter fences should be of sufficient height to contain the animals in the site facility and to protect the animals in
facility by restricting animals and authorized persons from going through it, under it, or having contact with the animals in
the facility, and so that can function as a secondary containment system for the animals in the facility.
Correct by January 12, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
KATHARINE FRANK, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
